intro: Dichrocephala integrifolia subsp. gracilis, commonly known as slender dichrocephala, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often with a striking two-toned appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
